column4: Still having trouble using apt-get & aptitude to install subversion.. Getting "E: Couldn't find package subversion." Anyone else have any suggestions?
Have you enabled all of your repositories?
Flurdy has a good post in the Ubuntu Forums about setting up a mail server
How do I go about doing that?
I'm a former Fedora user, and not familiar with Ubuntu yet..
edit your /etc/apt/sources list and make sure multiverse and universe repositories are enabled by removing the # sign in the front of the line, and then sudo aptitude update
running that now.. Thanks for the info.. I'm more familiar with yum than apt/aptitude... so this is all new to me..
I guess it was the update I needed to run.. The multiverse & universe weren't commented out...
I wasnt sure what repository it was in, so sorry
I'm running this as my sources.list..
General tip to upgrade packages: sudo aptitude update && sudo aptitude safe-upgrade
Thanks.. Is aptitude similar to apt as svn is similar to cvs?

Yes I think today aptitude and apt-get are virtually the same and interchangeable.  I think aptitude handles dependencies better (or at least it used to).  I prefer aptitude but perhaps I'm biased from the old days
Thanks again for the info.. Everything is installed and working now.. If you're ever in Oklahoma City, I owe you a beer! thanks again
Sometimes however when aptitude isn't working or giving me strange messages, I defer to apt-get and the install works!
